010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
013import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
014import imagingbook.common.color.cie.CieUtils;
015import imagingbook.common.color.gamma.ModifiedGammaMapping;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
018
019import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
020import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D65;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This is a sample implementation the sRGBcolor space which does not depend on ICC profiles. See Sec. 14.4 of [1] for details.
025 * Components of all {@code float[]} colors are supposed to be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
026 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the associated instance.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
030 * (2022).
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2023/03/31
035 * @see LinearRgb65ColorSpace
036 */
037@SuppressWarnings("serial")
038public class sRGB65ColorSpace extends AbstractRgbColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
039
040        // tristimulus values and white point:
041        private static final double xR = 0.64, yR = 0.33;
042        private static final double xG = 0.30, yG = 0.60;
043        private static final double xB = 0.15, yB = 0.06;
044        private static final double[] xyW = D65.getXy();
045        private static final ModifiedGammaMapping GammaMap = ModifiedGammaMapping.sRGB;
046
047        private static final sRGB65ColorSpace instance = new sRGB65ColorSpace();
048        public static sRGB65ColorSpace getInstance() {
049                return instance;
050        }
051
052        /** Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB. Its column vectors are the XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries. */
053        private final float[][] MrgbiF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgbi);
054        
055        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ (inverse of {@link #Mrgbi}). */
056        private final float[][] MrgbF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgb);
057        
058        // ----------------------------------------------------
059        
060        /** Constructor (not public). */
061        private sRGB65ColorSpace() {
062                super(xR, yR, xG, yG, xB, yB, xyW[0], xyW[1]);
063        }
064
065        // Methods required by ColorSpace (conversion from/to PCS space) ------------------
066
067        @Override       // assumes xyz50 is in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
068        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50PCS) {
069                float[] xyz65 = catD50toW.applyTo(xyz50PCS);    // to XYZ (D65)
070                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);                                // to sRGB
071        }
072
073        @Override // returned colors are in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
074        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgbTHIS) {
075                float[] xyz65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(srgbTHIS);              // to XYZ (D65)
076                return catWtoD50.applyTo(xyz65);                                // to XYZ (D50)
077        }
078
079        // direct conversion from/to D65-based XYZ space ------------------------------
080        
081        @Override       // converts from XYZ65 to this sRGB
082        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
083                float[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(MrgbF, xyz65);    // to linear RGB
084                return GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb);                                  // to non-linear sRGB
085        }
086        
087        @Override       // converts from sRGB to XYZ65
088        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] srgbTHIS) {
089                float[] rgb = GammaMap.applyInv(srgbTHIS);              // to linear rgb
090                return Matrix.multiply(MrgbiF, rgb);                    // to XYZ (D65)
091        }
092        
093        // ----------------------------------------------------
094
095        @Override       // convert from a color in this space to sRGB
096        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
097                return srgb;    // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
098        }
099
100        @Override       // convert from sRGB to a color in this space
101        public float[] toRGB(float[] srgbTHIS) {
102                return srgbTHIS;        // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
103        }
104
105        // public static void main(String[] args) {
106        //      PrintPrecision.set(9);
107        //      sRGB65ColorSpace CS = sRGB65ColorSpace.getInstance();
108        //
109        //      float[] wXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {1, 1, 1});
110        //      float[] rXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {1, 0, 0});
111        //      float[] gXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {0, 1, 0});
112        //      float[] bXYZ = CS.toCIEXYZ65(new float[] {0, 0, 1});
113        //      System.out.println("XYZ65 white = " + Matrix.toString(wXYZ));   // {0.950455904, 1.000000000, 1.089057684} = D65
114        //
115        //      System.out.println("XYZ65 red = " + Matrix.toString(rXYZ));     // {0.412390798, 0.212639004, 0.019330818}
116        //      System.out.println("XYZ65 grn = " + Matrix.toString(gXYZ));     // {0.357584327, 0.715168655, 0.119194783}
117        //      System.out.println("XYZ65 blu = " + Matrix.toString(bXYZ));     // {0.180480793, 0.072192319, 0.950532138}
118        //
119        //      System.out.println("xy65 red = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtils.XYZToxy(rXYZ)));    // {0.639999986, 0.330000013}
120        //      System.out.println("xy65 grn = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtils.XYZToxy(gXYZ)));    // {0.300000012, 0.600000024}
121        //      System.out.println("xy65 blu = " + Matrix.toString(CieUtils.XYZToxy(bXYZ)));    // {0.150000006, 0.060000002}
122        //
123        //      System.out.println("Mrgbi = \n" + Matrix.toString(CS.getMrgbi()));
124        //              // {{0.412390799, 0.357584339, 0.180480788},
125        //              // {0.212639006, 0.715168679, 0.072192315},
126        //              // {0.019330819, 0.119194780, 0.950532152}}
127        //      System.out.println("Mrgb  = \n" + Matrix.toString(CS.getMrgb()));
128        //              // {{3.240969942, -1.537383178, -0.498610760},
129        //              // {-0.969243636, 1.875967502, 0.041555057},
130        //              // {0.055630080, -0.203976959, 1.056971514}}
131        // }
132
133}
